title: Create or update a contract record
content:
The Contracts page displays all the active and inactive contract records you have with your vendors / customers. You manage your contract records from this page.

 

To manage contracts, you must have the Contract manager role. For more information about this role, see Default roles.

Create a contract record

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Contract > Contracts.
  2. Click New.

  3. Select the type of contract you want to create:

     

    A user with the appropriate permissions can customize the list of contract types. For more information, see Lists.

    Type Description
    Service A contract with a vendor / customer for services
    Maintenance A contract with a vendor / customer for maintenance services
    Lease schedule A contract detailing the terms and conditions of a lease schedule with a vendor / customer
    Master lease A contract detailing a master lease with a vendor / customer
    License A contract detailing a license agreement with a vendor / customer
    Purchase A contract with a vendor / customer detailing purchasing terms and conditions
    Warranty A contract with a vendor / customer detailing a warranty for supplied goods or services
    Non-disclosure agreement A contract detailing a non-disclosure agreement with a vendor / customer
    Master agreement A contract detailing a master agreement with a vendor / customer
  4. Select the initial phase at which you are creating the contract in the system. For workflow details, see Contract workflow.

  5. Enter the contract name, and the contract details. See the Contract details section.

  6. Save the details.

Update a contract record

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Contract > Contracts.

  2. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  3. Update the contract details. See the Contract details section.

  4. To view parent and children contracts, click the Related contracts tab.

     
    • You can view the relationships in a tabular view or in a tree view.
    • Use the tree view to view sibling contracts.

  5. To add, edit, or view the terms and conditions of the contract, click the Terms and Conditions tab. For more information, see the Terms and Conditions section.

  6. If the Expense lines capability is enabled in Application settings, you can view the expense lines generated or created for the contract in the Finance tab. 
  7. To open, join, or view a discussion or to view or post comments, click the Discussions tab. For more information, see Discussions.
  8. To view changes or updates made to the record, click the History tab. For more information, see History.

  9. Save your changes.

You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

Contract details

  • General contract details

     

    Click Show more to show all of the details.

    Field Description
    Name The name of the contract.
    Contract type The type of contract - see the How to create or update a contract record section.
    Contract number

    The number of the contract.
    Administrator The person responsible for the life cycle of the contract.
    Vendor / Customer The vendor / customer with whom there is a contractual agreement.
    Vendor / Customer contact The name of the contact at the vendor / customer.
    Effective from The date upon which the contract becomes effective.
    Expires on

    The date on which the contract expires.

    By default, a notification message is sent to the administrator of the contract 60 and then 30 days before the contract's expiry date. For more information, see the Notification configuration section.
    Parent contract The contract's parent contract from which it inherits the master terms and conditions. Select a contract from the drop-down list.
    Suspended If selected, the contract is put on hold. The execution of the contract is frozen until the contract's activity is resumed.
    Description Other details about the contract.
    Close code Closes the contract. The contract can be closed without any reference to either party, or it can be ended by the vendor / other company or by your company.
    Close reason A description of why the contract was closed.

  • Payment details

    Field Description
    Contract price The price of the contract.
    Initial cost The basic, minimum, upfront price of the contract.
    Recurring cost This is the extra amount charged for the contract, every time period specified in the recurring period field.
    Recurring period Define how often the recurring cost is charged for the contract.
    Currency The currency in which the payments are to be made.
    Tax rate (%) The tax rate; differs depending on the location of the vendor / customer.
    Payment terms The terms of payment as agreed upon between both parties.
    Cost center The business unit to which the device is charged.
    Cost type The type of cost. For example, hardware maintenance or software.

  • Notification configuration

    Here you can specify a date in advance of a contract expiration when Service Management notifies the administrator of the contract.

    Field Description
    Notify before (days) The number of days in advance of the contract expiration that the first notification is sent.
    Then notify before (days) The number of days in advance of the contract expiration that the second notification is sent.

    For more information, see Notifications.

  • Renewal

    This section allows you to configure additional notification for a contract that automatically renews. For example, you may want additional notice so as to negotiate fresh terms before losing the right to cancel the contract.

    Field Description
    Automatically renew Select if the contract automatically renews.
    Cancel renewal before (days)

    The amount of notice in advance of the contract expiration date which the company must give to cancel the contract, failing which it automatically renews. For example, 30 days.

    Service Management automatically calculates the renewal cancellation date, being the date which occurs the stated number of days in advance of the expiration date.

    If a contract is automatically renewable, and the option is selected, Service Management notifies the administrator of the contract:

    1. First, the number of days specified in Notify before (days) in advance of the renewal cancellation date.

    2. Second, the number of days specified in Then notify before (days) in advance of the renewal cancellation date.

    For more information, see Notifications.

  • Covered devices

     

    Available for the following contract types:

    • Lease schedule

    • Maintenance

    • Purchase

    • Warranty

    The devices that are covered by the contract.

    • To select devices covered by the contract, click Add .

    • To remove a device, select it and click Remove.

    • To make the current maintenance or warranty contract the default for devices, click Set as default.

    • To remove the current maintenance or warranty contract as the default for devices, click Clear default.

  • Covered enterprise assets

     

    Available for the following contract types:

    • Lease Schedule

    • Maintenance

    • Purchase

    • Warranty

    • To select enterprise assets covered by the contract, click Add .

    • To remove a enterprise asset, select it and click Remove.

    • To make the current maintenance or warranty contract the default for enterprise assets, click Set as default.

    • To remove the current maintenance or warranty contract as the default for enterprise assets, click Clear default.

  • Covered infrastructure & peripheral

     

    Available for the following contract types:

    • Lease schedule

    • Maintenance

    • Purchase

    • Warranty

    • To select infrastructure & peripheral assets covered by the contract, click Add  .

    • To remove an infrastructure & peripheral asset, select it and click Remove.

    • To make the current maintenance or warranty contract the default for infrastructure & peripheral assets, click Set as default.

    • To remove the current maintenance or warranty contract as the default for infrastructure & peripheral assets, click Clear default.

  • Covered licenses

     

    Available for the following contract types:

    • License

    • Maintenance

    • To select license assets covered by the contract, click Add .

    • To remove a license asset, select it and click Remove.

    • To make the current maintenance contract the default for licenses, click Set as default.

    • To remove the current maintenance contract as the default for licenses, click Clear default.

  • Covered persons

     

    Available for non-disclosure agreement contracts only

    The persons covered in the non-disclosure agreement contract.

    To select covered persons, click Add .

  • Covered services

     

    Available for service contracts only.

    Services provided by the vendor / customer that must be covered to fulfill the contract's terms and conditions.

    To select services covered by the contract, click Add .

  • Covered products (Model)
     
    This section is available for all contract types if CSM is enabled.

    Product models covered under the contract. To select product models covered by the contract, click Add .
  • Related products (Instances)
     
    This section is available for all contract types if CSM is enabled.
    Product instances associated with the contract.

  • Attachments

    To attach a file to the record, click Add attachment.

     
    • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.

    • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.

    • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

Terms and Conditions

 
Enter the terms and conditions in the Terms and conditions box, and then click Save on the toolbar.
 
If CSM is enabled, the Options section is available for contracts of type Service, Maintenance, and Purchase. The fields in the Options section are visible when CSM is enabled but are not functional. Entering values in these fields will have no effect. The following table provides descriptions for these fields for informational purposes only.
Field Description
Support type The type of support for the entitlements associated with the contract. The available options are: Phone, Portal or Web, Any.
Track requests
Indicates whether requests raised against the entitlements associated with this contract are tracked.
 
Select Yes to track requests and define the maximum number of requests supported. 
Select No if there is no limit on the number of requests supported.
Support hours The time period during which support is available.
Contracted requests The maximum number of requests allowed against the entitlements associated with the contract. This field is enabled only if Track requests is set to Yes.
Remaining requests The number of requests the customer can still raise against the entitlements associated with this contract. This field is enabled only if Track requests is set to Yes.
Case frequency The frequency at which the customer can raise requests. The available options are: Monthly, Yearly.
